snippet: Mitu Gulati, a Duke law professor, who with Lee Buchheit, a New York lawyer, developed the blueprint for Greece’s bond write-off, says that similar deals would help other indebted countries.
abstract: Duke law professor Mitu Gulati, who with New York lawyer Lee Buchheit developed the blueprint for Greece’s bond write-off, sees the deal as a model for other indebted countries; European officials disagree, holding the view that Greece's debt problems are unique and that there is no need for countries like Portugal, Ireland, Spain and Italy to push creditors to accept losses on their holdings, but Gulati continues to tout his idea.
lead_paragraph: Mitu Gulati, a Duke law professor, who with Lee Buchheit, a New York lawyer, developed the blueprint for Greece’s bond write-off, says that similar deals would help other indebted countries.

headline.seo: An Architect of Greece’s Debt Deal Wants More to Come
headline.main: An Architect of a Deal Sees Greece as a Model
